refnamediv.refpurpose: connect a socket to a local stream socket server and chain

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: local-stream-socket-connect is a chain-loading utility that opens a local stream socket, connects it to server-path with connect3, and then chain loads to next-prog with the execvp3 function, having set up I/O and environment variables per the UCSPI conventions.
next-prog may contain its own command line options, which local-stream-socket-connect will ignore.
If the --verbose option is used, local-stream-socket-connect logs information about connections made.

refsection.title: UCSPI (specifically UCSPI-UNIX) conventions
refsection.para: next-prog is expected to follow the UCSPI conventions: standard input, output, and error are the same as whatever local-stream-socket-connect inherited; file descriptors 6 and 7 are (respectively) reading from and writing to the connected socket, which it should treat as generic I/O streams and not expect to be a socket; and information about the local and remote ends of the connected socket is in environment variables. Whatever local-stream-socket-connect itself inherited as file descriptors 6 and 7 is closed.

local-stream-socket-connect obtains information about the local socket connection using the getpeername2, getsockname2, and (if available) SO_PEERCRED option of the getsockopt2 library functions, and sets up the UCSPI-UNIX conventional environment variables as follows:

listitem.para: This always has the value UNIX, indicating the prefix to the names of the remaining environment variables.

The local (client) path of the connecting socket. Normally, the operating system assigns this; but an explicit assignment can be requested with the --local-path command-line option, where client-path is a pathname.
The remote (server) path of the connected socket, in human-readable form.
The PID of the remote (server) process.
The effective UID of the remote (server) process.
The effective GID of the remote (server) process.
